page.title: 02A FARM NR.CRICKET ST.THOMAS
page.content: The Old Bakery is situated about 4 miles from Chard,Ilminster and Crewkerne,in the village of Chillington.This smallholding consists of a small yard containing five buildings.One is used for storing kindling wood (firewood),one to keep cattle in and three for chickens. The farm has two cows which produce milk for the family,they put calves on one of the cows.They have fifty chickens,the eggs are sold to passers-by, and two horses. They own two and a half acres which has been in the family for forty five years.They also rent three acres. Each year they make about 150 bales of hay,but they buy in the straw for the winter.
